alert.note: Alert for Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 1:35AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Madison and Washington AR. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated areas of light to moderate rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is likely ongoing. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches will be possible in some areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville... Huntsville... Prairie Grove... Elkins... West Fork... Lincoln... Greenland... Wesley... Japton... Brentwood... Drake Field Airport... Aurora... Witter... Strickler... Kingston... Georgetown... Durham... Tuttle... Sulphur City... Hicks... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
